briefdescription.para: Opaque object representing a way message stream.

detaileddescription.para: DBusTransport abstracts various kinds of actual transport mechanism, such as different network protocols, or encryption schemes.

briefdescription.para: Try to open a new transport for the given address entry.

parameterdescription.para: location to store reason for failure.

simplesect.para: new transport of NULL on failure.

briefdescription.para: Increments the reference count for the transport.

simplesect.para: the transport.

briefdescription.para: Decrements the reference count for the transport.

detaileddescription.para: Disconnects and finalizes the transport if the reference count reaches zero.

briefdescription.para: Closes our end of the connection to a remote application.

detaileddescription.para: Further attempts to use this transport will fail. Only the first call to _dbus_transport_disconnect() will have an effect.

briefdescription.para: Returns TRUE if the transport has not been disconnected.

detaileddescription.para: Disconnection can result from _dbus_transport_disconnect() or because the server drops its end of the connection.

simplesect.para: whether we're connected

briefdescription.para: Returns TRUE if we have been authenticated.

detaileddescription.para: It will return TRUE even if the transport is now disconnected, but was ever authenticated before disconnecting.
This replaces the older _dbus_transport_get_is_authenticated() which had side-effects.

simplesect.para: whether we're authenticated

briefdescription.para: Returns TRUE if we have been authenticated.

detaileddescription.para: It will return TRUE even if the transport is now disconnected, but was ever authenticated before disconnecting.
If we have not finished authenticating, but we have enough buffered input to finish the job, then this function will do so before it returns.
This used to be called _dbus_transport_get_is_authenticated(), but that name seems inappropriate for a function with side-effects.

xrefdescription.para: we drop connection->mutex when calling the unix_user_function, and windows_user_function, which may not be safe really.

simplesect.para: whether we're authenticated

briefdescription.para: See dbus_connection_get_is_anonymous().

simplesect.para: TRUE if not authenticated or authenticated as anonymous

briefdescription.para: Returns TRUE if the transport supports sending unix fds.

simplesect.para: TRUE if TRUE it is possible to send unix fds across the transport.

briefdescription.para: Gets the address of a transport.

detaileddescription.para: It will be NULL for a server-side transport.

simplesect.para: transport's address

briefdescription.para: Gets the id of the server we are connected to (see dbus_server_get_id()).

simplesect.para: transport's server's id or NULL if we are the server side

briefdescription.para: Handles a watch by reading data, writing data, or disconnecting the transport, as appropriate for the given condition.

parameterdescription.para: the current state of the watched file descriptor.

simplesect.para: FALSE if not enough memory to fully handle the watch

briefdescription.para: Sets the connection using this transport.

detaileddescription.para: Allows the transport to add watches to the connection, queue incoming messages, and pull outgoing messages.

simplesect.para: FALSE if not enough memory

briefdescription.para: Performs a single poll()/select() on the transport's file descriptors and then reads/writes data as appropriate, queueing incoming messages and sending outgoing messages.

detaileddescription.para: This is the backend for _dbus_connection_do_iteration(). See _dbus_connection_do_iteration() for full details.

parameterdescription.para: indicates whether to read or write, and whether to block.
if blocking, timeout or -1 for no timeout.

briefdescription.para: Reports our current dispatch status (whether there's buffered data to be queued as messages, or not, or we need memory).

simplesect.para: current status

briefdescription.para: Processes data we've read while handling a watch, potentially converting some of it to messages and queueing those messages on the connection.

simplesect.para: TRUE if we had enough memory to queue all messages

briefdescription.para: See dbus_connection_set_max_message_size().

parameterdescription.para: the max size of a single message

briefdescription.para: See dbus_connection_get_max_message_size().

simplesect.para: max message size

briefdescription.para: See dbus_connection_set_max_received_size().

parameterdescription.para: the max size of all incoming messages

briefdescription.para: See dbus_connection_get_max_received_size().

simplesect.para: max bytes for all live messages

briefdescription.para: See dbus_connection_set_max_message_unix_fds().

parameterdescription.para: the max number of unix fds of a single message

briefdescription.para: See dbus_connection_get_max_message_unix_fds().

simplesect.para: max message unix fds

briefdescription.para: See dbus_connection_set_max_received_unix_fds().

parameterdescription.para: the max unix fds of all incoming messages

briefdescription.para: See dbus_connection_set_max_received_unix_fds().

simplesect.para: max unix fds for all live messages

briefdescription.para: Get the socket file descriptor, if any.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to fill in with the descriptor

simplesect.para: TRUE if a descriptor was available

briefdescription.para: See dbus_connection_get_unix_user().

parameterdescription.para: return location for the user ID

simplesect.para: TRUE if uid is filled in with a valid user ID

briefdescription.para: See dbus_connection_get_unix_process_id().

parameterdescription.para: return location for the process ID

simplesect.para: TRUE if uid is filled in with a valid process ID

briefdescription.para: See dbus_connection_get_adt_audit_session_data().

parameterdescription.para: return location for the ADT audit data

simplesect.para: TRUE if audit data is filled in with a valid ucred

memberdef.argsstring: (DBusTransport *transport, DBusAllowUnixUserFunction function, void *data, DBusFreeFunction free_data_function, void **old_data, DBusFreeFunction *old_free_data_function)
memberdef.name: _dbus_transport_set_unix_user_function

briefdescription.para: See dbus_connection_set_unix_user_function().

parameterdescription.para: data to pass to the predicate
the old user data to be freed
old free data function to free it with

briefdescription.para: See dbus_connection_get_windows_user().

parameterdescription.para: return location for the user ID

simplesect.para: TRUE if user is available; the returned value may still be NULL if no memory to copy it

memberdef.argsstring: (DBusTransport *transport, DBusAllowWindowsUserFunction function, void *data, DBusFreeFunction free_data_function, void **old_data, DBusFreeFunction *old_free_data_function)
memberdef.name: _dbus_transport_set_windows_user_function

briefdescription.para: See dbus_connection_set_windows_user_function().

parameterdescription.para: data to pass to the predicate
the old user data to be freed
old free data function to free it with

briefdescription.para: Sets the SASL authentication mechanisms supported by this transport.

simplesect.para: FALSE if no memory

briefdescription.para: See dbus_connection_set_allow_anonymous()
Return how many file descriptors are pending in the loader.
Register a function to be called whenever the number of pending file descriptors in the loader change.
